dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 3937 IH: To designate the building utilized as a United States courthouse located at 150 Reade Circle in Greenville, North Carolina, as the “Judge Randy D. Doub United States Courthouse”.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Butterfield (for himself, Mrs. Ellmers of North Carolina, Mr. Jones, Mr. Price of North Carolina, Ms. Foxx, Mr. Walker, Mr. Rouzer, Mr. Hudson, Mr. Pittenger, Mr. McHenry, Mr. Meadows, Ms. Adams, and Mr. Holding) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To designate the building utilized as a United States courthouse located at 150 Reade Circle in Greenville, North Carolina, as the Judge Randy D. Doub United States Courthouse.

section.text: The building utilized as a United States courthouse located at 150 Reade Circle in Greenville, North Carolina, shall be known and designated as the Judge Randy D. Doub United States Courthouse during the period in which the building is utilized as a United States courthouse.

With respect to the period in which the building referred to in section 1 is utilized as a United States courthouse, any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to that building shall be deemed to be a reference to the Judge Randy D. Doub United States Courthouse.
